com.jcraft.jsch

Class KeyExchange

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jcraft.jsch.KeyExchange
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DHECN, DHG1, DHG14, DHGEX

    public abstract class KeyExchange
extends Object
    Usually not to be used by applications. Abstract base class for key exchange algorithms. The concrete implementation will be chosen based on the configuration and on the negotiation between client and server.
    See Also:
    RFC 4253, 7. Key Exchange, RFC 4253, 8. Diffie-Hellman Key Exchange

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public abstract void init(Session session,
                          byte[] V_S,
                          byte[] V_C,
                          byte[] I_S,
                          byte[] I_C)
                   throws Exception
        Initializes the key exchange object. The parameters here seem to be specific to the Diffie-Hellman Key exchange specified by RFC 4253, other Key Exchange mechanisms might need other parameters.
        Parameters:
        session - the session object.
        V_S - the server's identification string sent before negotiation
        V_C - the client's identification string sent before negotiation
        I_S - the server's complete SSH_MSG_KEXINIT message.
        I_C - the server's complete SSH_MSG_KEXINIT message.
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        RFC 4253, 7. Key Exchange, RFC 4253, 8. Diffie-Hellman Key Exchange

      • next

        public abstract boolean next(Buffer buf)
                      throws Exception
        Does the next step in the key exchange algorithm.
        Parameters:
        buf - the received packet. It will have the same message-type as getState() returned before.
        Returns:
        false if there was some problem, true if everything was okay.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getState

        public abstract int getState()
        returns the identifier of the next SSH packet expected, or STATE_END if the KeyExchange was already successfully finished.

      • getKeyType

        public String getKeyType()
        Returns the type of key used by the server. With current algorithms, this is either "DSA", "RSA" or "ECDSA".

      • getKeyAlgorithName

        public String getKeyAlgorithName()

      • guess

        protected static String[] guess(byte[] I_S,
                                byte[] I_C)

      • getFingerPrint

        public String getFingerPrint()
        returns the finger print of the server's public key. This uses the HASH implementation given by session.getConfig("md5").
        Returns:
        the (lowercase) hexadecimal representation of the MD5 hash of the server's public key.

      • normalize

        protected byte[] normalize(byte[] secret)

      • verify

        protected boolean verify(String alg,
                         byte[] K_S,
                         int index,
                         byte[] sig_of_H)
                  throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception
